subject: HowStuffWorks Automotive Newsletter May 29, 2007
body:
howstuffworks® | automotive May 29, 2007
RSS
 
 Subcompact Car Showdown  Growing concerns over rising fuel costs and the environment
have prompted many Americans to consider buying smaller, more fuel-efficient
cars such as the Honda Fit, Suzuki SX4, Chevrolet Aveo and Toyota Yaris.
Consumer Guide decided to put these pint-size players to the test and compare
their pros and cons. Check out our test drive results. Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How Convertibles Work - A convertible car and a sunny day are a match made in
heaven. See how a convertible top works, check out a retractable hardtop and
take a look at some of the challenges faced by designers of convertible cars.
 

How Mufflers Work - If you've ever heard a car engine running without a muffler,
you know what a huge difference a muffler can make to the noise level. Look
inside a real car muffler and learn about the principles that make it work.
 

2009 BMW M3 Review - For 2009, BMW completes the overhaul of its best-selling
line with a new high-performance M3 featuring the model's first-ever V-8 power
and many other modifications. Learn what sets the 2009 BMW M3 apart from its
3-Series brethren.
   
This Week's Video
 

How the Denso Navigation System Works - The 2007 Toyota Camry has a new and improved navigation
system with a faster processor, touch-screen interface and voice activation.
Learn what's new in auto navigation technology from parts manufacturer Denso.
